name: CheatsandTrix-Redshift
tagline: Some insights, cheats and tricks for working with AWS Redshift that helped me
body:
### Welcome to my AWS Redshift Cheats, Tricks and Tips:
This page is mostly for my own reference, compiled from notes, hacking sessions and other learnings on AWS Redshift. I love using Redshift, and if you have the need for a data warehouse with a lot more flexibility, optimized performance and query ability, check out Redshift. You'll be glad you did!


## Security
1 Use SSE - S3 will handle for you. If using Client-side, use the COPY command to load data - it decrypts during copy.
2 Connect string - On the SQL client I've not had problems with the "jdbc" prefix, but SSL is available (details [here](http://docs.aws.amazon.com//redshift/latest/mgmt/connecting-ssl-support.html#connecting-ssl-support-java) )
3 ACL - All set up in IAM
4 Credentials - Connecting to a server uses your access and secret keys. Connecting via a sql client uses your masteruser credentials (Ideally create a non-masteruser user) that you set up when launching the cluster.
5 Encryption - Encryption on the database on user tables is setup at launch time
6 Security groups - Confusing. Cluster-security groups in ec2-classic; VPC in non ec2-classic
